p: Regarding O. biennis, the administration of the seed oil (namely, evening primrose oil) in animal models enhanced PGE1 synthesis in peritoneal macrophages, decreased PGE2 amounts in granulocytes, and suppressed the natural killer (NK) cell activity and lymphocyte proliferation; moreover, it decreased the serum levels of interferon γ (IFN-γ) and MCP-1, while stimulating TNF-α [ 187, 188, 189, 190, 191]. Furthermore, anti-inflammatory effects have been found to be involved in the immunomodulation by evening primrose oil [ 160].
